unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I've been thinking a lot about our planet, especially after watching that "Bell Bottom" movie – even Akshay Kumar is saving the world on screen! But seriously, folks, the real threat is right here, and it’s our reliance on fossil fuels. We need to talk about renewable energy.
normalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I've been thinking a lot about our planet, especially after watching that "Bell Bottom" movie – even Akshay Kumar is saving the world on screen! But seriously, folks, the real threat is right here, and it’s our reliance on fossil fuels. We need to talk about renewable energy.

unnormalised: Think about it: India gets so much sunshine – practically baking us during the summers! Why aren’t we harnessing that power more effectively? Solar panels on every rooftop from Kashmir to Kanyakumari. Imagine the possibilities! And it's not just solar, wind energy is also catching on big time. Rajasthan, with its vast open spaces, is perfect for wind farms.

Rajasthan, with its vast open spaces, is perfect for wind farms.

unnormalised: We need to shift away from coal-fired power plants, which are seriously contributing to pollution, especially in cities like Delhi. My grandmother in Kolkata always complains about the air quality, and honestly, it's heartbreaking.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, for example, is doing some amazing research on renewable energy technologies. They're developing more efficient solar cells and exploring new ways to store energy. It’s institutions like these that give me hope.

unnormalised: Investing in renewable energy isn't just about saving the planet; it’s also about creating new jobs and boosting our economy. Think of all the opportunities for engineering students, entrepreneurs, and even rural communities!
normalised: Investing in renewable energy isn't just about saving the planet; it’s also about creating new jobs and boosting our economy. Think of all the opportunities for engineering students, entrepreneurs, and even rural communities!

unnormalised: Plus, imagine a future where our energy bills are drastically reduced! No more hefty Rs. 5000 electricity bills every month! That’s a win-win in my book.
normalised: Plus, imagine a future where our energy bills are drastically reduced! No more hefty rupee five thousand electricity bills every month! That’s a win-win in my book.

unnormalised: So, what can you do? Start small! Switch to LED bulbs, conserve energy at home, and support businesses that are committed to sustainability. Even just talking about it with your friends and family helps raise awareness. Every little bit counts! Let's make India a leader in renewable energy, one sunny rooftop at a time! Let's travel to Agra via Electric car for a cleaner environment.
